properties.areaDesc: Rockingham, NH; York, ME; Strafford, NH
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 5:56PM EST until January 8 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Southern York County in southwestern Maine...
Northeastern Rockingham County in southern New Hampshire...
Strafford County in central New Hampshire...

* Until 700 PM EST.

* At 556 PM EST, an area of dangerous snow squalls were located
along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Sanford to near
Raymond, moving southeast at 30 mph.

Snowfall rates in these squalls have been reported as high as 2
inches in 45 minutes. Expect dangerous travel conditions, near zero
visibilities at times with snow and ice covered roads.

HAZARD...Snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 95 between mile markers 1 and 26.
Interstate 95 in New Hampshire between mile markers 8 and 16.

This also includes...
York Beach, Ogunquit Beach, and Wells Beach.

Locations impacted include...
Rochester, Portsmouth, Durham, Kittery, Alfred, Sanford, Northwood,
Dover, Somersworth, Kennebunk, Barrington, Berwick, Farmington,
Epping, Lebanon, Barnstead, Epsom, Greenland, Kennebunkport and South
Berwick.
properties.instruction:
Travel is not advised during this dangerous snow squall.  Rapid
visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to
accidents.  Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your
location.  If traveling, pull off to a safe location and turn your
headlights on.

Temperatures are above freezing, but sharply colder temperatures
following the snow will cause any water or slush to quickly freeze on
roads and sidewalks.  Untreated road surfaces will become extremely
slippery.  Reduced speeds and increased distance between vechicles is
advised.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 7:00 PM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
